0909981001-d-10-06-98-WW.Narrative: SANMAN 6 WAS BOUND FOR HAGERSTOWN, MD WITH 3 UNITS 12 LOADS OF SAND, 2 LOADS OF COMPOSITE LUMBER ANDONE EMPTY COVERED HOPPER.  ALL LOADS WERE ON THE HEAD END.  THE 15TH HEAD CAR WAS A LOAD OF SAND INA SMALL CUBE COVERED HOPPER.  CAR WW 7032 16 WAS A LOAD OF LUMBER ON A CENTER BEAM FLAT EQUIPED ANF SHANK COUPLER TTZX 863185.  AS THE TRAIN DECENDED A HILLL INTO A CURVE THE FORCE SET UP BETWEEN THE 14TH & 15TH CAR CAUSED WW 7032 TO FORCE THE RAILS APART AND FALL IN.  A RAIL BROKE ALLOWING WW 7032 AND TTZX 863185 TO GET OFF THE END OF THE TIES.  WW 7032 TURNED OVER CAUSING WW 3090 AND TTZX 863185 TO DO THE SAME.  TTZX 83795 (CAR17) AND AMCX 6743 (CAR 18) REMAINED UPRIGHT BUT DERAILED.  IN ALL200 FEET OF TRACK WAS DESTROYED AND 100 FEET.  HAD TO BE REGAUGED. THERE WAS NO DRUGS OR ALOCHOL INVOLVED.  NO HAZARDOUS MATERIAL WAS INVOLVED.  NO DESEL FUEL RELAESED.  THE CAUSE WAS A WEAK TRACK STRUCTURE (DEFECTIVE TIES) THAT WAS UNABLE TO TAKE THE LATERAL FORCES SET UP BETWEEN WW 7032 AND TTZX863185.NoneNoneNoneNone

G4419-d-10-17-98-WC.Narrative: THE CONDUCTOR CHECKED TO SEE IF THEY HAD ALL THE CARS BEFORE STARTING THE SHOVE.  HE GAVE THE ENGINEER THE GO AHEAD TO SHOVE, STATING THEY HAD ROOM FOR 10 CARS.  THE ENGINEER SHOVED APPROXIMATELY 5 CARS AND TRIED TO CONTACT THE CONDUCTOR AGAIN.  THE CONDUCTOR HAD GOTTEN BACK INTO A VEHICLE TO HEAD BACK TO THE WEST END WHEN HE HEARD THE ENGINEER CALLING HIM, HE WAS NOT PROTECTING THE SHOVE. BY THETIME THE CONDUCTOR RESPONDED TO THE ENGINEER'S CALLS, THE ENGINEER HAD STOPPED THE MOVEMENT.  THE CONDUCTOR THEN WENT BACK TO CHECK THE CARS AND FOUND THAT THEY HAD SIDESWIPED A STANDING CUT OF CARS (10 LOADS AND 20 EMPTIES) ONTRACK 10.  THE TWO CARS ON TRACK 10 THAT WERE DERAILED WERE REFRIGERATORCARS, ONE CAR LOST APPROXIMATELY 300 GALLONS OF FUEL.  THE CAR THAT WAS PART OF THE TRAIN BEING SHOVED SUSTAINED DAMAGE BUT WAS NOT DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

EMPLOYEE DISCIPLINE WAS IMPOSED ON BOTH THE EMPLOYEE INVOLVED IN THE MOVEMENT OF TRAIN 4326, AND THE TRAIN CREW MEMBERS (CONDUCTOR, ENGINEER ANDASSISTANT CONDUCTOR) OF TRAIN 4304, WHO WERE DISCIPLINED FOR FAILING TO POSITION TRAIN IN THE CLEARON TRACK 12 IN JOHNSON AVENUE YARD.NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

HE SHOVED ABOUT 8 OR 10 CAR LENGTHS TOWARD VOSS WHEN HE LOOKEDBACK AND SAW CAR ROCKING BACK AND FORTH TELLING HIM HE HAD CARS ON THE GROUND.  THE REPAIR CREW SAIDTHAT THE TIES LOOKED GOOD BUT WERE ROTTED ON THE INSIDE.  THE CONSTANT PRESSURE ON THE OUTSIDE RAILACTUALLY PUSHED THE RAIL OVER ON ITS SIDE DERAILING FIVE CARS BEFORE HE GOT THEM STOPPED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
